physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Prepatellar bursa was swollen, fluid-filled, with trace local erythema. No warmth or tenderness; aspirated fluid showed 55,000 WBCs/mm3, predominantly lymphocytes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Persisting effusion and elevated WBC counts in subsequent aspirates despite treatment with itraconazole; required surgical excision after lack of clinical improvement.
